programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the MEO Rip Curl Pro Portugal presented by Corona Cero 2025
programme.desc: The MEO Rip Curl Pro Portugal presented by Corona Cero Replay showcases elite surfing at Supertubos, one of Europe's premier beach-breaks known for its powerful, hollow waves and consistent barrels. As the third stop on the 2025 World Surf League Championship Tour, this event is crucial for competitors looking to build momentum in their World Title campaigns.

programme.title: All In | Jordy Smith Searches For The Magic Surfboard For France
programme.desc: The surfers arrive in France for the next stop on the WSL World Championship Tour, the Quiksilver & Roxy Pros. For Jordy Smith and Lakey Peterson, the search is on for the magic surfboard to compete in the shifting beachbreak waves of Hossegor. Meanwhile, Carissa Moore and Julian Wilson prepare for competition by fine-tuning their bodies for the grueling days of competition ahead.

programme.title: WSL Competition Highlights
programme.desc: See all the best scores from the WSL surfing season.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the VIVO Rio Pro presented by Corona Cero 2025
programme.desc: The World Title race is set to supercharge in Saquarema. The passion of Brazil's surf fans, the electric atmosphere of Saquarema, and the pressure of the back half of the season are unmatched. It's loud. It's wild. It's must-watch professional surfing. Replay Final's Day as the World Title race continues in Brazil.

programme.title: All In | Julian Wilson Surfs Through Injury at Snapper Rocks
programme.desc: As the surfers make final preparations to travel to their next WSL World Championship Tour events in France for the Quiksilver & Roxy Pro, they reflect on their 2018 season so far. For Julian Wilson and Lakey Peterson, a World Title is within reach. And while Carissa Moore and Jordy Smith are out of the title hunt this year, they still want to prove they are the two best surfers in the world. The stakes are raised at the Quiksilver & Roxy Pro France and the Surf Ranch Pro as the race for points and the fight for the WSL World Title intensifies.

programme.title: WSL Competition Highlights
programme.desc: See all the best scores from the WSL surfing season.

programme.title: WSL | #TourNotes
programme.desc: Take an inside look at the day-to-day of the World Surf League tour.

programme.title: Casbah Coast | Brilliant Corners: Algeria, Episode 1
programme.desc: Host and Longboard Champion Sam Bleakley travels to Algeria with Australian longboarder and writer Lucy Small, French surfer and adventurer Erwan Simon, and local Dihya Nasri, the only female surfer in all of Algeria. They continue to explore the over 1,000 miles of mostly unsurfed Mediterranean coastline, paddling out at a slabbing wave near the capital city of Algiers. Sam Bleakley, Lucy Small, Erwan Simon, and Dihya Nasri have a dawn patrol session at a nearby break and meet some of the local surfers in the tight-knit community as they continue to explore Algeria, one of the Brilliant Corners of the earth.

programme.title: WSL | Unboxing Things With Koa Smith
programme.desc: Koa Smith takes a look at all the latest surfing gear.

programme.title: Inside Pro Surfing: Lexus Pipe Pro presented by YETI 2025
programme.desc: Welcome to the starting line. The champs are back, the rookies have arrived, and the entire surf universe turns its eyes to the place where it all begins: the North Shore of O`ahu. Reigning Pipe champs Barron Mamiya and Caity Simmers, rookies Erin Brooks and George Pittar, and the rest of the world’s best are ready to fire the Championship Tour back up. The 2025 Tour starts NOW.

programme.title: LIVE: WSL Surfing 2026 BTMI Barbados Surf Pro
programme.desc: Live from Soup Bowl at Bathsheba, Barbados.

programme.title: 2025 TUDOR NAZARÉ Big Wave Challenge | REPLAY
programme.desc: The deepwater canyon of Portugal's famous Nazaré set the stage for Big Wave's finest to battle for the 2025 Tudor Nazaré Big Wave Challenge. Heavy wipeouts, full sends, and a clash of defending champs taking on perennial Big Wave standouts provided plenty of adrenaline-pumping action. Nic Von Rupp and Clement Roseyro emerged victorious with Justine Dupont stamping her authority at the arena of Nazaré once more to top the women's leaderboard alongside Roseyro taking the men's leaderboard win.

programme.title: Inside Pro Surfing: Surf Abu Dhabi Pro 2025
programme.desc: The WSL Championship Tour makes its groundbreaking debut in the Middle East at the 2025 Surf Abu Dhabi Pro. The second stop on the CT marks professional surfing's continued global expansion and also establishes Abu Dhabi as an official surf destination. Engineered for excellence, this high-performance wave will provide a canvas for the world's best surfers set against a stunning backdrop of the Arabian Gulf. The event will showcase not only the remarkable evolution of professional surfing beyond its traditional roots, but also the infinite possibility for progression from athletes like rookie Erin Brooks, former World Champion Italo Ferreira, and reigning World Champ Caity Simmers.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the Lexus Pipe Pro presented by YETI 2025
programme.desc: Welcome to the starting line. The champs are back, the rookies have arrived, and the entire surf universe turns its eyes to the place where it all begins: the North Shore of O`ahu. Relive Final's Day action as the world’s best fire the Championship Tour back up. The 2025 Tour starts NOW.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the Western Australia Margaret River Pro 2025
programme.desc: The Western Australia Margaret River Pro is the 7th stop on the 2025 World Surf League Championship Tour. Replay Final's Day at this crucial event, marking the mid-season cut, where the world's best surfers put it all on the line to advance through to the next section of the tour. Margaret River brings raw power, pumping waves and unforgettable drama.

programme.title: Can Julian Wilson Keep His Winning Momentum Going in Portugal? | All In Ep5
programme.desc: While Julian Wilson and Jordy Smith head to Portugal for the MEO Rip Curl Pro Peniche, Carissa Moore and Lakey Peterson travel home to relax for a month before having to compete in the final event on the women's WSL World Tour season, the Beachwaver Maui Pro. After his win in France, Julian needs a good result in Portugal to have a chance at the men's world title. For Jordy, Portugal is a chance to let loose and charge. For every surfer, this is the most critical point in the world tour season, as the Hawaiian leg looms on the horizon.

programme.title: Inside Pro Surfing: Rip Curl Pro Bells Beach presented by Bonsoy 2025
programme.desc: Bells Beach on Victoria's South Coast is the longest-running surfing competition and will host the 62st edition this year. Bells is Australian surfing heritage. With the hope of scoring long-period, groomed walls, the surfers will need to display the perfect combination of power, precision, and timing. The biggest surfing legends have had the honor of winning and ringing ‘The Bell' and 2025 will see a hungry new generation vying for the opportunity to cement their names in one of surfing's most prestigious events.

programme.title: All In | Pipeline To Decide Who Will Be Crowned World Champion
programme.desc: The Hawaiian leg of the WSL World Tour has arrived. For Lakey Peterson to still have a shot at the World Title, she has to win the final event of the women's tour's season, the Beachwaver Maui Pro — then beat Stephanie Gilmore in a surf off. For Julian Wilson, it all comes down to Pipeline, where he's been crowned a Pipe Master before. The pressure is on as All In approaches its final episodes.

programme.title: Inside Pro Surfing: Surf City El Salvador Pro 2025
programme.desc: Where the Pacific's perfect right-hand point break meets an unparalleled competition venue, the Surf City El Salvador Pro delivers an opportunity for CT athletes to earn critical points in the rankings ahead of the Mid-season Cut. Long, powerful walls offer endless opportunity for progressive maneuvers while the hollow sections demand split-second decision-making that can test even the most seasoned CT competitor. As the season's fourth event, El Salvador marks a pivotal moment in World Title campaigns.

programme.desc: CA fishes with Richard Black in Islamorada. This guy can do it all. Rain or shine, no fish is safe.

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: How do you catch a persnickety Redfish? One bite at a time.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: C.A. heads to Apalachicola for a mixed bag of redfish and fresh oyster.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Huge Sheepshead lurk in Jersey's waters. Nick heads out with Capt. Dan Schafer to ply trophy sheeps from the bridge pilings.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits Key Largo to search out backwater battles with snook, reds, trout and surprises in Florida Bay with Capt. Bruce Davis.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick hits the Islamorada backwaters with Bud N' Mary's legends Capts. Richard and Nick Stancyzk to tempt bonefish and permit on the flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Sailfish, tuna, macks, and more as Nick joins Captain Jack Walker to rip up the pelagics offshore in Key West.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Follow along as Mark Peterson travels to Tanzania to hunt the Eastern and Western White-Bearded Wildebeest. These animals are known for their distinctive white beards and large horns, making them a sought-after trophy for hunters on an African safari. Mark sets out on an exciting and thrilling adventure to track down these elusive creatures in the plains of Tanzania.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's thrilling adventure in Tanzania continues as he sets his sights on the elusive Grant's Gazelle and the striking Fringe-Eared Oryx. Armed with his precision-engineered Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, Mark is poised to make every shot count. The real challenge lies not just in the accuracy of his aim but in getting close enough to these magnificent creatures.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father Earl have spent six thrilling days immersed in the wilds of Tanzania, exploring the heart of Africa. Next on their adventure, they set out to hunt the elusive Chandler's Mountain Reed buck. However, the raging river poses a formidable challenge, making it too dangerous to cross. Undeterred, they adapt by using alternative means of transportation. Armed with their trusty Gunwerks rifles, they navigate the rugged terrain, determined to get close to these elusive creatures amidst the stunning and challenging landscape.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark continues his hunt in Australia on Marble Island. After a successful first day, the group heads out the next morning in search of a Sambar stag. After closing the distance Mark isn’t able to get a steady rest so they move in closer while the Sambar stag is on the move.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he continues his hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of Maasai Land, Tanzania. Mark moves to a different camp in this episode to pursue a Gerenuk, known for its long neck and unique browsing habits. He soon after turns his attention to the East African Impala.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke grabs a TenPoint crossbow and kicks back on "Island Time," along with the Nashville rockers from Loose Lips.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: Designed for hunters and outdoor enthusiasts, this machine combines power, comfort, and versatility to tackle even the toughest terrain. From its impressive suspension to its spacious design, the RMAX4 1000 LE is built to perform in the field and beyond.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We follow along with the crew from Struttinbuck on their annual Father Son hunt at FE Hill. No matter what happens throughout the year this is always a must have trip and a time to settle down and enjoy the great outdoors.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc:
"On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.
Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen’s 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary’s ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin’s history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson finds himself deep in the heart of Peru and focuses on completing the prestigious South America Upland Slam. With only one bird remaining, the Western Peruvian Dove, the trip has led him to a private hunting property. This final challenge will take place over a cut cornfield, a favorite spot for the doves. To blend in, Mark and his team craft a makeshift blind using a mix of corn stalks, and timber, just enough cover while allowing for a clear shot. These West Peruvian Doves are known for their erratic flight patterns, often bouncing from one tree to another in a random manner, making timing and placement critical.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Ty’s passion for the outdoors has certainly transcended to the next generation and his kids can’t get enough! Hunter and Alexa both tagged mature bucks with one being a very typical and the other a wild nontypical in this family episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc:
In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true?
We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like.
We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Wildbound by Forloh
programme.desc: In this episode Andy and his friend Scotty take on Kodiak Island, Alaska for an adventure of Salmon fishing and hunting black tail deer. Whilst traversing steep mountains in the company of Kodiak brown bears and taking on cold Alaskan waters, Andy presents useful information for fellow outdoor enthusiasts all whilst building friendships with the great people of Kodiak Big Timber Lodge.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey from The Lindsey Way is on a mission for one deer — a buck they call “Junior.” After passing him the year before, Jeff spends months trying to catch up with the elusive whitetail. He makes mistakes, second-guesses himself, and faces plenty of close calls. But exactly one year to the day after letting Junior walk, Jeff climbs back into the same stand — and this time, it all comes together.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, we're headed out to Oklahoma to follow along with the Sharp brothers as they hunt whitetails in their home state. You never know what to expect with these two but one thing you can always rely on is that they always have some big deer to go after!

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a frenzy of exciting Bluefish near Marathon, FL.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Blair and Leiza Fitzgerrald search the Indian River Lagoon for redfish to tag for the CCA STAR Tournament.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: Capt. Jason Dozier teams up with Capt. David Paycheck for a day of firsts. Jason tries a new style of bass fishing with David, and then introduces David to hunting Moorhen for the first time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade and Caleb head back to Missouri to catch the end of bow season, and the start of rifle. Slade arrows a great buck (twice), and we preview the latest property Slade & Co. purchased in MO.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc:
In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks down what’s involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-key hunting properties.
Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkey kill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The "Trained Assassins" are back and it’s turkey season in the Midwest. In this first episode, Slade, Blake, and Ryan start in Missouri, run into some trouble, but end up getting it done on the first leg of the 2024 turkey tour.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA takes his Son Cam to the Sports Coast for some friendly Father Son competition.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: How do you catch a persnickety Redfish? One bite at a time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing in Key West, you can often get a lot done in a little bit of time. After an early check in to Ocean’s Edge Resort and a mid day departure from then dock, Ali looks to Rush to put him on an afternoon bite of tuna and bottom fish that few other places can offer. If Rush is going to deliver, he will need to make a plan and stick to it to make the best use of this limited time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Sammy Millazo Fishing Offshore Islamorada.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Lake Vermilion is home to some amazing fishing opportunities with crappies being one of them!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss travels to Melbourne, on Florida’s Space Coast, to cast flies with Capt. Noah Miler at some unforgettable fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.desc: In Week 4 of Season 2, the Arizona Pickleball League brings another exciting Tuesday night match at The Orchard. This week, the Peoria Pythons take on the Surprise Stingers, with thrilling moments and intense competition. Featuring standout players like Ryan Trefry, Lauren Mercado, Michael Lloyd, and Nico Montoya, the teams face off in a high-energy battle. From dynamic mixed doubles to powerful gender doubles, every set and game keeps viewers at the edge of their seats. Will the Pythons maintain their momentum, or will the Stingers make a dramatic comeback? Don’t miss this action-packed match full of strategy, drama, and plenty of pickleball!

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2025 - US Open 2025 - Men's Pro Doubles - Munro/Yang vs. Bhatia/Mehta
programme.desc: Welcome back to the 2025 Minto US Open Pickleball Championships for the Men's Pro Doubles semifinal match. This is a great representation of the sport's global growth, with the top-ranked player from India competing. The match features teams Munro and Yang against Bhatia and Mehta. The match is tightly contested, with the level of play stepping up as they enter the semi-finals. The caption file also notes that Bhatia's grandfather was a world-renowned cricketer in India with the nickname "the Sultan of Swing," which is comparable to an NFL star like Tom Brady.

programme.desc: The Men’s Doubles Open Quarterfinal at the 2023 English Nationals delivers a riveting showdown as rising talents Daniel Wren and Alex Woolf take on the experienced pairing of Wesley Jackson and Bernie Audibert. Every point is a test of patience, power, and precision, with both teams refusing to back down in this critical battle for a spot in the semifinals.With crowd energy building and momentum swinging back and forth, this match captures the grit and skill that define top-tier British pickleball. Who will punch their ticket to the next round?

programme.title: World Pickleball League (WPBL) - WPBL 2025 - Bengaluru vs. Chennai - Day 1 Tie 2
programme.desc: It's the "Southern Derby" in the World Pickleball League (WPL) as Bengaluru takes on Chennai in the second tie of the day, live from the CCI Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. The match features 48 players from six teams and 14 countries, with commentators detailing every crucial point.The tie begins with a thrilling Men's Singles match: Bengaluru's Blaskowitz (a Croatian talent) faces Chennai's Sobek (the Polish national champion). The commentators highlight the extreme patience and dinking skills demonstrated by both players, with Sobek's ability to keep the ball low being a key factor.

programme.desc: In this intense Gold Medal Match from the 2024 US Open Pickleball Championships, Marcello Jardim takes on Marco Osorio in a thrilling Men’s Pro Singles showdown. With sharp baseline play, quick hands at the net, and relentless rallies, this match captures the competitive spirit and elite talent of pro pickleball at its finest.

programme.title: National Collegiate Pickleball Association (NCPA) - NCPA Indiana Regional 2025 - Collegiate Team Match - Wisconsin vs. Purdue
programme.desc: Live from The Picklr in Noblesville, this NCPA Indiana Regional 2025 matchup features a critical battle between the University of Wisconsin-Madison and Purdue University. With eight national bids and $5,000 in prize money on the line, the stakes are high as the 16th-seeded Purdue takes on the 17th-seeded Wisconsin in a best-of-seven format.The match kicks off with Gender Doubles, where Wisconsin’s duo of Noah and Sarah Sowinski showcase dominant net play and quick hands against Purdue’s Caleb Yang and Trevor Ju. Watch for standout moments, including an incredible Ernie from Wisconsin and strategic adjustments in the Mixed Doubles games involving Colton Thielman and Elena Schlichte.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2025 - US Open 2025 - Mixed Split Pro Age - Oncins/Jardim vs. Miscik/Domoracki
programme.desc: Get ready for an exciting Mixed Split Pro Age pickleball match featuring the formidable team of Jaime Oncins and Simone Jardim against the new pairing of Ryan Miscik and Christie Domoracki. Oncins is a former professional tennis player from Brazil. His partner, Simone Jardim, is a professional pickleball player, a Pickleball Hall of Fame inductee, and was once ranked the number one female player in the world. They face a new team with Ryan Miscik, a pro pickleball player and coach based in Venice, Florida. His partner, Christie Domoracki, is a player located in Boca Grande, Florida. This match brings together a mix of experienced pros and up-and-coming talent for a high-stakes competition on Florida's Paradise Coast.

programme.desc: Watch as the formidable mother-daughter duo, Lee and Anna Leigh Waters, take on challengers from North Carolina in this Pro Women's Doubles match from the US National Pickleball Center. After an injury, it is great to see the champions partner up again, demonstrating the "fire and ice" style of play that has made them national champions. While the Waters team's game one was a quick 11-point victory, the challengers, Fuzesi and Maloof, handled themselves well on the championship court. The players at home can learn from Anna Leigh's "instigator" shots and two-handed backhand rolls, which she helped bring to the big stage.

programme.title: Air Time Podcast - Sean Miskiman
programme.desc: Sean is an up-and-comer from Saskatchewan, Canada. He grew up riding contests and by the age of 18 bailed and dove head first into filming in the backcountry. The kids got a bright future! Thanks for joining me boss. Enjoy.

programme.title: La Zone
programme.desc:
In the early 2000's, snowboard filmer David 'Vlad' Vladyka and a handful of riders discovered an off-the-radar area on the French-Swiss border that held massive potential for shooting freestyle snowboarding. The mountain pass featured rolling terrain punctuated by steep roll overs that are perfect for building jumps. The area was Le Col de Cou, and though it had a name, the riders called it 'La Zone', a purposefully vague nickname that would help them keep the area a secret.
Over the next decade, La Zone would become one of the most productive and standard setting locations for filming freestyle snowboarding in all of Europe. Shots from La Zone were featured in several Absinthe films, and many others.
Now 20 years later, Jones team rider Mat Schaer and Vlad still return to La Zone to film from time to time, but the pristine slopes they enjoyed in the past are much harder to find as Le Col de Cou has become a popular ski touring destination.
Featuring new and historic footage from La Zone, this new short film directed by Julien Rosens, and produced by Absinthe Films, highlights the history, beauty and inevitable evolution of this legendary shred spot.
Credits LA ZONE, a movie directed by Julien Roserens Produced by Absinthe Films Supported by Jonessnowboards, Region Dents du Midi, Doodah store Edited by Jules Guarneri Soundmix by Stephane Chapelle Graphics by René Zumstein Photo by Michael Cordey Music : Tugrul by Ochre, Rhea by Yehezkel Raz, Where It Beginns It Ends by Be Still The Earth, Strange Life de YGGL, Let Us Get Out by Redder

programme.title: Doodah Presents: Spacé - Couloir
programme.desc: Snowboarder Frederik Kalbermatten lives surrounded by 13 mountains, each higher than 4,000 meters. Only a few have dared these descents. Some couloirs are accessible when conditions are perfect, others only open their doors for a brief moment. Kalbermatten masters them all with flow and style.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: More
programme.desc: Absinthe raises the bar again. 'More' ushers in a new era of urban riding, deep powder, massive jumps, and the groundbreaking ‘Human Drone’ to bring you closer to snowboarding than ever before.

programme.title: La Quinta Films Presents: Lines
programme.desc: Lines is a documentary about big mountain snowboarding. The dedication. The nerve. The skill. As we follow the Absinthe Films crew for six weeks in Haines, Alaska, we also explore the colorful characters, history and dangers of big mountain riding. Directed by Axel Pauporté and Flora Richard.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: Motherload
programme.desc: The hardest part of any adventure is getting out the door. Planning is tedious. Packing is time consuming. Once on-hill, everything falls into place. Follow pro skiers Izzy Lynch and Tessa Treadway as they carry the load of life changing events and the love of their children into the mountains.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Kimmy Fasani - Dose 03
