programme.desc: In contrast to artificial toboggan runs, natural toboggan runs consist of mountain roads and trails. Natural track tobogganing requires a completely different technique than on an artificial track. At the finish, hundredths of a second decide whether you win or lose.

programme.title: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2022
programme.desc: The Natural Selection Tour 2022 features the world’s greatest men and women snowboarders competing on the planet’s most epic terrain in all-time conditions.

programme.title: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2022
programme.desc: Fieberbrunn, (AUT), March 14th 2022 The Freeride World Tour has its 4th stop. This takes place in Austria at Fieberbrunn. It is exciting to see what the first stop of the final has to offer after the spectacular three qualifying stages!

programme.title: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2025
programme.desc: Located in the heart of the Swiss Alps, the Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025 is one of the most exciting events on the freeride calendar. This unique competition brings together some of the world's best backcountry athletes to showcase their skills.

programme.title: Simple Session 2025 - BMX Finals MEN
programme.desc: Simple Session is back at Unibet Arena in Tallinn, Estonia – celebrating its massive 25-year anniversary! A quarter-century of mind-blowing BMX riding and skateboarding, unforgettable moments, and a global community of athletes pushing the limits.Hoppla!

programme.title: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2024
programme.desc: Welcome to World of Freesports and the Freestyle Pro Tour 2024! Get ready to witness the world’s best freestylers perform jaw-dropping tricks and intense competition on the water. Let the battle for the title begin - it’s time for freestyle action!

programme.title: E-Bike World Tour 2024
programme.desc: The Verbier E-Bike Festival, held in Verbier, Switzerland, from August 14-18, 2024, is Europe's premier e-mountain biking event, attracting thousands of participants and spectators. In its sixth edition, the festival features a diverse range of activities.

programme.title: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2024
programme.desc: Welcome to the breathtaking shores of Dakhla, Morocco - where the desert meets the sea. We´ll take you on a jounrey as athletes harness the power of the wind, riding the waves and soaring through the skies in one of the world´s most stunning watersport destinations.

programme.title: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2026 - WOF 2026 _06_ World Downhill Skateboarding Champio
Trans Madeira 2024 Autumn: Full Highlights
programme.desc: Trans Madeira combines the best things the island has to offer with five days of racing in the World’s most diverse terrain, exploring all four corners of the island, starting high in the mountains and finishing down at the ocean.

programme.title: Actionclip GKA22 BigAir ESP TwinTip Women Strapless Overall
programme.desc: Actionclip GKA22 BigAir ESP TwinTip Women Strapless Overall

programme.title: Actionclip OERM22 AUT Traum Kurzfilm
programme.desc: Actionclip OERM22 AUT Traum Kurzfilm

programme.title: 2025 Formula Kite European Championships - Live delayed
programme.desc: The Formula Kite European Championships 2025 took place in Urla (Turkey) from May 11 to 19 and brought together the best kiteboarders in Europe for a week of high-speed hydrofoil racing.

programme.title: WOF Evergreens
programme.desc: Aurelien Routens from France was vice world champion at the Freeride World Tour 2013 and has made a name for himself with his outstanding web series "Carpe Diem". In our 26-minute portrait, the 36-year-old talks about his life as a snowboard professional.

programme.title: MIT100 - Triathlon Mauritius
programme.desc: The "MIT100 - Mauritius International Triathlon" is a prestigious annual triathlon event held in Mauritius. It attracts athletes from around the world, offering a challenging course with a 1.8 km swim, a 55 km bike ride, and a 12 km run.

programme.title: WES - World E-Bike Series, UCI E-Mountainbike World Cup Cross Country, Race 3 & 4 - Germany
programme.desc: Welcome to WES rounds 3 and 4 of the UCI E-Mountainbike Cross-Country World Cup presented by Schwalbe. We are in Bielstein, Germany, for the second year in a row and the Bielstein Forest Course is the venue for this event and one of Europe's oldest motocross circuits.

programme.title: WES - World E-Bike Series, UCI E-Mountainbike World Cup Cross Country, Race 5 & 6 - Belgium
programme.desc: Welcome to WES World E-Bike Series Round 5 and 6. We are at Spa-Francorchamps, in Belgium, the iconic circuit, for this event presented by EICMA. The UCI E-Mountain Bike Cross-Country World Cup comes to the spectacular woods of this world-famous venue for the third year

programme.title: Trans Madeira 2024 Autumn: Full Highlights
programme.desc: Trans Madeira combines the best things the island has to offer with five days of racing in the World’s most diverse terrain, exploring all four corners of the island, starting high in the mountains and finishing down at the ocean.

programme.title: Vendée Globe - LIVE Part 2
programme.desc: The Vendée Globe aims to use the media impact of the event to raise public awareness of ocean conservation throughout the round-the-world race. They are direct witnesses to the changes underway, particularly around Antarctica, a region that is under particular threat.

programme.title: 10 Years Laax Open
programme.desc: The Laax Open is one of the most prestigious snowboard events, celebrating its 10th anniversary this year. Against the backdrop of the Swiss Alps, the Laax Open offers a unique blend of energetic sport and lively après-ski culture.

programme.title: A Feather in the West
programme.desc: In September 2019, a team of talented Irish climbers [Chloe Condron, Kevin Kilroy, Michelle OLoughlin and Conor McGovern] travelled to the small island of Owey to explore sea cliffs that local guidebook writer Iain Miller claims, have “enough new routing potential to last at least twelve lifetimes”. ‘A Feather in the West’ is a film about their trad climbing experiences and the relatively niche pursuit of first ascents, set on the Wild Atlantic Way, off the west coast of County Donegal. (Special thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: Skiing China Exploring Altai Mountains
programme.desc: A quartet of champion skiers and snowboarders from Australia and the USA visit the unexplored Altai Frontier in China, now believed to be the place where skiing first developed, more than 10,000 years ago. They encounter the ancient culture of the region and explore the spectacular local slopes, using their own hi-tech equipment as well as the traditional skis manufactured by local craftsmen using age-old practices. The four visitors, Scott Kneller, Jari Hiatt, Halina Boyd and Harry Kearney, all of whom have world-beating careers in snowboarding, skiing and ski mountaineering, discover new challenges and new frontiers in China’s remote north-western province.

programme.title: Best Via Ferrata In The Dolomites Climbing Possnecker Eng
programme.desc: Cris and Viv climb Piz Selva, a 2,941m mountain belonging to the Sella group, an iconic giant of the Dolomites.They start their hike from Passo Sella, and their chosen route was via Ferrata Possnecker (also called Ferrata delle Mesules), one of the oldest Via Ferratas in the Dolomites.

programme.title: Climbing Skye s Highest Peak - Sgurr Alasdair
programme.desc: Cris and Viv decided to climb Sgurr Alasdair, the highest mountain on the island of Skye, located in an area of the mountain range known as Black Cullin. The main challenge they had in climbing the peak was the Great Stone Chute. A 300-meter slope of the harshest mountain terrain - scree. The summit of Sgurr Alasdair has unobstructed views of all of the Munroes in the Black Cullin, and also of one of Skyes most famous routes - The Cullin Ridge traverse.

programme.title: The Rise of the Hamminator Lindsey Hamm s journey from concrete to peaks
programme.desc: Mammut athlete Lindsey Hamm, a professional climber and mountain guide, brings a breath of fresh air to the world of mountaineering. Originally from Texas, she has begun making a name for herself in recent years. This short film offers a glimpse into her life, a recent expedition to Pakistan’s wild Charakusa Valley. Beyond the mountains, Lindsey is a people person, driven by a passion for inclusivity in climbing, and giving opportunities to other women, who want to get into the sport. She collaborates with womens organizations in Pakistan, helping to dismantle barriers and create opportunities for education and growth.

programme.title: Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025
programme.desc: Nestled in the heart of the Swiss Alps, the Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025 is one of the most exciting events on the freeride calendar. This unique competition brings together some of the world’s top backcountry athletes, showcasing their incredible skills and creativity in untouched snow.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2025 Season Recap - Unfinished Business Eng
programme.desc: This exclusive episode offers fans a fresh and emotional look back at the season, featuring the most thrilling moments, behind-the-scenes insights, and never-before-seen interviews with the athletes who defined the year.

programme.title: Norcha Eng
programme.desc: Norcha is more than a race — it’s a journey into the heart of human endurance. Set against the breathtaking landscapes of northern Portugal, Norcha follows teams of adventurers as they leave their comfort zones and confront a challenge designed to push the very limits of body and mind. Trekking, kayaking, mountain biking, rappelling — every stage forces competitors to adapt, to endure, and to discover new depths of resilience. But Norcha is not just about competition. It is about connection — with teammates, with nature, and with the spirit of exploration itself. Guided by values of solidarity, humility, and dedication, this odyssey reveals that the greatest victories are not only measured at the finish line, but in the moments of transformation along the way.

programme.title: Raid Gallaecia 2025
programme.desc: In the frontier between Galicia and northern Portugal, adventure racing returned to one of Europe’s most unspoiled regions with Raid Gallaecia 2025. Over five days and nearly 500 kilometers, 28 international teams battled mountains, forests, rivers, and exhaustion in a non-stop race of strategy, endurance, and teamwork.

programme.title: New Zealand 9
programme.desc: In a race against time, three adventurers will set a new speed record by completing New Zealand’s nine Great Walks faster than they’ve ever been done before, using human power alone. It’s the ultimate adventure race. They’ll kayak 145 km, ride 80 km and run over 300 km in just nine days.

programme.title: Ultra Vegans
programme.desc: For endurance athletes, getting the right diet can make the difference between success and failure. Many are now choosing to adopt a plant based regime and they are witnessing some remarkable results in terms of performance and recovery. Athletes, fitness coaches, sports nutritionists, ultra runners are sharing with us their experience and conviction wether they are motivated by self performance or animal wellfare.

programme.title: Challenge Family 2025 - Season Wrap Up Eng
programme.desc: Since its founding, the Challenge Family triathlon series has redefined the spirit of endurance sports. Known for its unique courses, passionate community, and athlete-centered values, Challenge Family offers races in some of the world’s most iconic locations. From the breathtaking landscapes to the demands of each event, Challenge Family is about more than just competition. It’s about athletes pushing beyond their limits, fueled by the support of fans, family, and each other. Through the journeys of athletes, everyone can understand what it takes to prepare, to overcome, and to race with a purpose that goes far beyond the finish line.

programme.title: X-out Montenegro Eng
programme.desc: X-out Montenegro is part of the Xtri World Tour. Athletes starts with a 1.7 km open-water course. The race is started by the Xekutioner, a formidable figure who will be responsible for future eliminations. 15 of athletes will be eliminated by the Xekutioner, intensifying the competition. Eliminated athletes are given a time penatly and can then try to catch “The Splitter” to ovetake backmarkers and get back in the race! Then a tough and demanding 40 km asphalt cycle which climbs the famous serpentine above Kotor. Designed to test endurance to the max. Another 15 of athletes are eliminated by the Xekutioner here, ensuring only the toughest stay. Finally 6.5 km of downhill trail running and 2.5 km of “vertical” monster climbing. Again eliminated athletes have the opportunity to catch the leaders.

programme.title: Trans Sahara Marathon 2025
programme.desc: The Trans Sahara Marathon. Set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Sahara Desert, this epic race, held in February 2025, challenges runners to traverse 150 kilometers across four grueling stages of unforgiving terrain. Drawing the worlds top athletes from every corner of the globe, the Trans Sahara Marathon is more than just a race; its a testament to the boundless limits of human potential and the relentless pursuit of greatness.

programme.title: Trail Menorca Cami De Cavalls 2025
programme.desc: Welcome to a new edition of the Trail Menorca Camí de Cavalls Conecta Balear. 185 kilometers tracing the edge of a millennia-old island, blessed with unique natural beauty. Enchanted trails, towering cliffs, and dreamlike beaches shape one of the most demanding routes in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: Mongolia Horseback Archery World Championships 2023
programme.desc: For 2023, Mongolia and its capital Ulaanbaatar was brought in the spotlight of official horseback archery competition, that has grown a lot over the last few years in many places around the world. Everything started with the Spirit International HBA tournament in the beginning of September and this event would set the stage for the pinnacle one that was about to follow: the 2023 International Horse Archery Alliance World Championships.

programme.title: Hokkaido Japan by bike - Part 4 Eng
programme.desc: Our bikepacker friend Michele is exploring the Japanese island of Hokkaido. On the agenda: volcanoes, forests, wilderness, brown bears, fishing owls, the Pacific Ocean, and weather that isnt always kind. Episode 4.

programme.title: The First Second - Geraldine Fasnacht
programme.desc: When Geraldine, the bird woman puts on her mask, we know that the images of the pink wingsuit will be closer to poetry than adrenaline! Several snowboard world championship titles, more than 3200 jumps, but at the start, how do you decide to ride and fly all your life?

programme.title: Cycling home from China Eng
programme.desc: Josh spent 4 months self filming his bike trip home from the Giant bike factory in Shanghai. During his 15 000 km trip between Shanghai China and Newcastle UK, he crossed 19 countries. A fantastic human adventure and a unique bike trip !

programme.title: The First Second - Geraldine Fasnacht
programme.desc: When Geraldine, the bird woman puts on her mask, we know that the images of the pink wingsuit will be closer to poetry than adrenaline! Several snowboard world championship titles, more than 3200 jumps, but at the start, how do you decide to ride and fly all your life?

programme.title: The First Second - Michi Wohlleben
programme.desc: «The higher you raise the bar the further you fall down!”. Michi language is made of very strong, singular sentences, as sharpened as his climbing style. His sentences try to define himself, without worrying about himself, by thwarting clichés… but do not succeed in really finding himself. On the other hand his words create beautiful images that show Michis inspiration, fluidity, and pleasure in action. Through the discovery of his goals and his gamble with the risk, Michi mixes both quest and primal pleasure.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2025 - Christmas Special Edition
programme.desc: We start this episode from Romania. In our previous episodes, we covered the exciting 2025 edition of Brasov Running Festival, highlighting the effort of the Elite 10k athletes. However, the Brasov Running Festival is much more than just the elite competitors. We then shift our focus to cycling, moving on to Turkey for another edition of LÉtape Türkiye by Tour de France. Moving from Turkey, we catch a flight to Croatia for Spartan Trail Dubrovnik. Since this is the last episode of the TV Show for 2025, we also got a glimpse of some of the most notable moments we enjoyed over the previous months.

programme.title: 12th Longines Equestrian Beijing Masters 2025
programme.desc: China. Beijing. A city where history breathes through every stone and shimmer of steel. Here, where dynasties once rode across vast plains, a new kind of cavalry takes the stage riders of precision, courage, and grace. Each autumn, the National Stadium, the Bird’s Nest transforms. Where Olympic legends once soared, hooves now thunder. This is the Longines Beijing Masters — the heart of Asian equestrian sport, and a meeting place for the world’s finest.

programme.title: UIPM 2025 Obstacle World Championships
programme.desc: Beijing’s Olympic Centre turns into a proving ground as the UIPM Obstacle World Championships crown new stars across the 400 m, 3 K, and blistering 100 m sprint.

programme.title: International Temiscamingue Raid Eng
programme.desc: The International Temiscamingue Raid is the first stage event to be part of the Adventure Race World Series, an international series that specializes in adventure races and which brings together the best endurance athletes in the world. Last September, athletes from Brazil, Uruguay, Mexico, Finland and Canada and seven local teams from Temiscamingue participated in the Raid Témiscamingue.

programme.title: Spartan Beast World Championship 2025 Eng
programme.desc: Spartan is back again to the culturally rich and visually intoxicating dunes of Abu Dhabi, UAE for the 2025 Spartan World Championship hosted by Abu Dhabi Sports Council. The Spartan World Championship weekend will include a variety of different World Championship races. A select group of top elites will battle for the 3K Elite World Championship title, while Elite and Age Group racers looking for a more grueling challenge will take on the qualification-based 21K Beast Championships.

programme.title: Spartan Super World Championship 2025 Eng
programme.desc: High in Californias Sierra Nevada, the world gathers for a new test of endurance. This is the Spartan Super World Championship 2025, hosted by Mammoth Lakes, California. A race that starts at 2,400 metres above sea level and climbs higher still. Every athlete knows what waits ahead. 11 kilometres, 26 obstacles and the full force of the mountain.

programme.title: Hokkaido Japan by bike - Part 3 Eng
programme.desc: Our bikepacker friend Michele is exploring the Japanese island of Hokkaido. On the agenda: volcanoes, forests, wilderness, brown bears, fishing owls, the Pacific Ocean, and weather that isnt always kind. Episode 3.

programme.title: Mongolia Horseback Archery World Championships 2023
programme.desc: For 2023, Mongolia and its capital Ulaanbaatar was brought in the spotlight of official horseback archery competition, that has grown a lot over the last few years in many places around the world. Everything started with the Spirit International HBA tournament in the beginning of September and this event would set the stage for the pinnacle one that was about to follow: the 2023 International Horse Archery Alliance World Championships.

programme.title: The First Second - Geraldine Fasnacht
programme.desc: When Geraldine, the bird woman puts on her mask, we know that the images of the pink wingsuit will be closer to poetry than adrenaline! Several snowboard world championship titles, more than 3200 jumps, but at the start, how do you decide to ride and fly all your life?

programme.title: The First Second - Michi Wohlleben
programme.desc: «The higher you raise the bar the further you fall down!”. Michi language is made of very strong, singular sentences, as sharpened as his climbing style. His sentences try to define himself, without worrying about himself, by thwarting clichés… but do not succeed in really finding himself. On the other hand his words create beautiful images that show Michis inspiration, fluidity, and pleasure in action. Through the discovery of his goals and his gamble with the risk, Michi mixes both quest and primal pleasure.

programme.title: The First Second - Geraldine Fasnacht
programme.desc: When Geraldine, the bird woman puts on her mask, we know that the images of the pink wingsuit will be closer to poetry than adrenaline! Several snowboard world championship titles, more than 3200 jumps, but at the start, how do you decide to ride and fly all your life?

programme.title: Race to the Rock
programme.desc: The Race to the Rock is an annual unsupported ultra-distance bicycle race through the Australian Outback organized by Jesse Carlsson. Unlike stage races, such as the Tour De France, ultra-distance races start and run continuously until the competitors finish the race, forcing them to make such strategic choices as whether it would be better to take time to eat or sleep, or to sacrifice those things and press on. Race to the Rock is an unsupported race, which means that racers are not permitted to draft or to obtain help from anything other than publicly available sources that are available for all. The course varies every year, but finishes at Uluru, also known as Ayers Rock, and has been so gruelling that only a very small percentage of the competitors have ever finished the race. Roads are mostly unsealed, with limited water supplies, and stretches of 400-500 kilometres at times with no food resupply available.

programme.title: 2025 Aus Cycling MTB Enduro National Championships
programme.desc: A rain-soaked Collie, Western Australia, becomes the stage for Australia’s premier Enduro showdown, where world-class Wambenger Trails and the iconic Wellington Dam mural frame a weekend of grit, flow and community. Across Juniors, Masters, Adaptive and E-bike fields, riders wrestle slick rock, pea gravel and long liaison climbs as stories of resilience emerge. The result is a kinetic, human-centred portrait of Australian MTB: fast, muddy, inclusive, and unforgettable.

programme.title: Cro Race 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 CRO Race is a road cycling stage race (6 stages - 900 km) in Croatia held between 30 September and 5 October 2025. It is the tenth edition of the Tour of Croatia since its revival in 2015 and the sixth under the CRO Race name. The race is rated as a category 2.1 event on the 2025 UCI Europe Tour calendar

programme.title: Skoda Titan Desert Almeria 2025
programme.desc: Four intense days of mountain biking through Almería’s stunning landscapes — from coast to desert, across sand, hills, and rugged trails. Amateurs and pros alike face the heat, the wind, and their own limits. More than a race, it’s an adventure of endurance, camaraderie, and pure adrenaline beyond the stopwatch.

programme.title: Santos Tour Down Under Women 2026
programme.desc: 9th edition of the Womens Tour Down Under, which is the part of the 2026 UCI Womens World Tour.

programme.title: Santos Tour Down Under Men 2026
programme.desc: Australia’s greatest cycling race is back to launch the international cycling season. South Australia is celebrated at its best, taking the peloton across 6 stages. The 2026 Santos Tour Down Under mens race features a tough climb - Knotts Hill. Each stage pays homage to the events history while exploring great landscapes, promising thrilling challenges for the riders.

programme.title: Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025
programme.desc: Nedbank Gravel Burn is a 7-day, 800km full-service gravel stage race through South Africa’s diverse landscapes. Starting in coastal forests, the route heads into the breathtaking Great Karoo – a vast, spectacular semi-desert region. Riders rest each night in remote ‘Burn Camps’ under star-filled skies and, on the final day, greeted by Africa’s iconic Big 5 wildlife.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi will host the GKA Kite World Tour for the first time, bringing back-to-back World Cups in Hydrofoil Big Air and Freestyle to Fahid Island, Abu Dhabi’s newest coastal wellness destination and the world’s first Fitwel-certified island, offering 11kms of coastline.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup Dakhla - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: A full roster of 28 men and 16 women, from a total of 16 countries around the world, are set to join the line-up in Dakhla for five days of intense action that could have a key bearing on who takes the titles. Reigning world champions, France’s Capucine Delannoy and Brazil’s Gabriel Benetton, top the Kite-Surf rankings as they head to the season’s penultimate stop in Dakhla, Morocco, on the Sahara desert’s coastline.

programme.title: Changing Channels
programme.desc: Gerrard Gosens is set to become the first totally blind person to attempt the daunting 34+ km swim from Dover in the UK to Cape Gris-Nez in France. Battling the cold and unpredictable waters of the English Channel, Gerrard faces not only the rough conditions but also the need to swim in synchronization with his team of guide swimmers, Hayden, Phil, Jo, Rosie, Alexis, and Sarah by his side.

programme.title: All The Way Eng
programme.desc: From award-winning documentary filmmaker Carl Eneroth at Sthlm Social Innovation Lab comes "All the Way". A heart-pounding, intimate and mind expanding portrait of Swimrun team Pontus Lindberg and George Bjälkemo, as they prepare for their ultimate challenge… winning the 75 km ÖtillÖ Swimrun World Championships in the Stockholm archipelago… in trail shoes and a wetsuit.

programme.title: The First Second - Samantha Davies
programme.desc: Samantha Davies sees the ocean as a pleasure, obvious. In symbiosis with her boat, she leads a violent struggle with the harsh conditions and "loves it" in an almost inexplicable way! She knows and enjoys her luck, which she shares with Initiatives Cœur. She also measures it to that of her grandfather, a war submariner…. At the start of a race like the Vendée Globe, it is an adventurer who sets off.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup Taiba - Brazil 2025
programme.desc: Taíba, Brazil, host the final stop of the GKA Kite World Tour 2025. The world’s top riders will take to Taíba’s powerful Atlantic waves for four days of action-packed competition that will determine the men’s and women’s world titles. The event marks the thrilling conclusion to a season that has already visited Cape Verde, Dakhla, and Sylt.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cl ac h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: 2025 ROLEX New York Yacht Club Invitational Cup
programme.desc: Twenty teams from 12 countries would compete in the ninth Rolex New York Yacht Club Invitational Cup, the biennial regatta hosted by the New York Yacht Club Harbour Court in Newport, R.I. Since the event was first run in 2009, it has attracted top amateur sailors from 51 of the world’s most prestigious yacht clubs from 23 countries.

programme.title: Moana Waiwai - The Film
programme.desc: Moana Waiwai or The Great Ocean in Maori, is about the FreeSwim journey of wahine (woman) Ally Davey as she swims 70km of open ocean around the stunning Coromandel coastline over three days to raise awareness for the protection of New Zealands oceans. It does more than encapsulate stunning vistas and highlight the extraordinary New Zealand environment. It inspires people to be aware of the natural beauty that surrounds them.

programme.title: Nastro Rosa Tour 2025 Eng
programme.desc: The Marina Militare Nastro Rosa Tour returns in 2025 for its fifth edition, offering a unique journey that blends high-level competition with Italy’s maritime culture and coastal beauty. Since its debut in 2021, the Tour has grown into more than a sailing event—it has become a travelling festival of the sea, connecting athletes, coastal cities, and local communities in a shared celebration of sport, heritage, and discovery.

programme.title: SFT Wake Foil E-Foil World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates, will make history this autumn as it hosts the GWA Wingfoil World Cup for the first time, marking the grand finale of the 2025 FreeFly-Slalom season. Leading the charge are two-time defending world champions, Nia Suardiaz, of Spain, and Francesco Cappuzzo, of Italy, who head to Abu Dhabi leading the rankings. With the season’s final stop still wide open, both athletes will need flawless performances to secure their third consecutive titles.

programme.title: GKA Hydrofoil Big Air World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi will host the GKA Kite World Tour for the first time, bringing back-to-back World Cups in Hydrofoil Big Air and Freestyle to Fahid Island, Abu Dhabi’s newest coastal wellness destination and the world’s first Fitwel-certified island, offering 11kms of coastline.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates hosts the GWA Wingfoil World Cup for the first time, marking the grand finale of the 2025 FreeFly-Slalom season. Leading the charge are two-time defending world champions, Nia Suardiaz, of Spain, and Francesco Cappuzzo, of Italy, who head to Abu Dhabi leading the rankings. With the season’s final stop still wide open, both athletes will need flawless performances to secure their third consecutive titles.

programme.title: Oman Downwinder Eng
programme.desc: The Oman Downwinder movie intents to show Oman and its conditions for wind powered sports. It is a movie that explores behaviours, the Omani hospitality, the landscape and attractions of Oman within the downwinder route and not, exclusively, a movie about kitesufing/Wingfoiling. The movie was designed to explore the experience of professional kiteboarders/wingfoilers (Ambassadors) interacting with amateur riders based in Oman on this 7-day trip along the coast. Apart from the Ambassadors, the movie also explores the Oman Kitesurfing community via local actors and their experiences during the downwinder.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup Taiba - Brazil 2025
programme.desc: The second and final call of the GKA Freestyle season is set to play out in the sumptuous conditions of Brazil’s Taíba lagoon, where the 2025 world champions will be crowned. The world championship titles are in the balance after the opening stop in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, several weeks ago, ended inconclusively when the wind declined to play ball for the freestylers. That effectively makes the GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup Taíba 2025 a one-stop world championship for the 2025 titles, leaving no margin for slip-ups from leading contenders, who are all in Brazil.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi will host the GKA Kite World Tour for the first time, bringing back-to-back World Cups in Hydrofoil Big Air and Freestyle to Fahid Island, Abu Dhabi’s newest coastal wellness destination and the world’s first Fitwel-certified island, offering 11kms of coastline.

programme.title: Best Via Ferrata In The Dolomites Climbing Possnecker Eng
programme.desc: Cris and Viv climb Piz Selva, a 2,941m mountain belonging to the Sella group, an iconic giant of the Dolomites.They start their hike from Passo Sella, and their chosen route was via Ferrata Possnecker (also called Ferrata delle Mesules), one of the oldest Via Ferratas in the Dolomites.

programme.title: Nine Mountains
programme.desc: The journey of two cyclists (Leo Russell & George Stagg) on a mission to climb the 9 most challenging and notorious mountains in Europe. From Austria To Spain, Nine Mountains is an adventure of brutality and beauty exploring the limits of the mind and body. The boys cycled over 3,200km from blistering snowstorms to scorching deserts whilst ascending the equivalent of eight times the height of Everest. The film follows a never been done route with the aim to raise £100,000 towards mens mental health charity James Place, an organisation set up to help men in suicidal crisis.

programme.title: Dark Peak Fell Runners
programme.desc: The Dark Peak Fell Runners base themselves in Sheffield, but their playground is the Peak District National Park where they weave tracks through the fields, peat bogs and rocky outcrops to create a tapestry of eccentricity, endeavour and endurance. As one of the biggest pure fell running clubs in the UK, the ‘Dark Peak Fell Runners’ captures the personality, quirks and successes of the club and its members. Shot throughout the course of a year, the film follows in their footsteps to reveal their well-trodden Peak District running routes including the club’s flagship race, the Edale Skyline. (Special Thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025
programme.desc: Nestled in the heart of the Swiss Alps, the Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025 is one of the most exciting events on the freeride calendar. This unique competition brings together some of the world’s top backcountry athletes, showcasing their incredible skills and creativity in untouched snow.

programme.title: Grand Teton Loop Eng
programme.desc: Grand Teton National Park is a stunning and iconic park in the US, known for its majestic Teton Range, beautiful lakes, and diverse wildlife. In July of 2022, Jeff and Audrée made a stop on their way back to Canada while on a road trip to Colorado, so that they could run a 38 mile / 62 km loop around the park, which mile for mile would be one of the most scenic and beautiful routes theyve ever run.

programme.title: Expedition Antarctica of extreme sports woman Caro North
programme.desc: Iceclimbing, ski mountaineering and sailing the open water for days through the infamous Drake Passage: The 28 years old extreme sports woman Caro North made her way to the very South of our continent for a four weeks expedition – accompanied by an eight-member crew. Antarctica turned out to be a paradise for extreme sports: deserted landscapes and snow-capped mountains against a surreal backdrop of ice and sea were waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: A Feather in the West
programme.desc: In September 2019, a team of talented Irish climbers [Chloe Condron, Kevin Kilroy, Michelle OLoughlin and Conor McGovern] travelled to the small island of Owey to explore sea cliffs that local guidebook writer Iain Miller claims, have “enough new routing potential to last at least twelve lifetimes”. ‘A Feather in the West’ is a film about their trad climbing experiences and the relatively niche pursuit of first ascents, set on the Wild Atlantic Way, off the west coast of County Donegal. (Special thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: Dark Peak Fell Runners
programme.desc: The Dark Peak Fell Runners base themselves in Sheffield, but their playground is the Peak District National Park where they weave tracks through the fields, peat bogs and rocky outcrops to create a tapestry of eccentricity, endeavour and endurance. As one of the biggest pure fell running clubs in the UK, the ‘Dark Peak Fell Runners’ captures the personality, quirks and successes of the club and its members. Shot throughout the course of a year, the film follows in their footsteps to reveal their well-trodden Peak District running routes including the club’s flagship race, the Edale Skyline. (Special Thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: Lekkarod 2025
programme.desc: Depuis 10 ans, la Lekkarod est une course majeure du mushing en Europe. Affiliée aux fédérations nationale FFST et internationale IFSS, elle est une étape de la Coupe du Monde. Chaque année, une centaine de mushers et leurs chiens prennent le départ des 9 étapes de la Lekkarod, ou de celles des Trophées !For the past 10 years, the Lekkarod has been a major mushing race in Europe. Affiliated with the national FFST and international IFSS federations, it is a stage of the World Cup. Each year, around a hundred mushers and their dogs take part in the 9 stages of the Lekkarod, or those of the Trophies!

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2025
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe. This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers.

programme.title: Margalef - Climbing
programme.desc: Margalef is a little village next to the Monsant river, in Catalunya. The most amazing rocks in Europe and hundreds routes for climbing. Pure fun and climbing in this little entertaining film.

programme.title: The Rise of the Hamminator Lindsey Hamm s journey from concrete to peaks
programme.desc: Mammut athlete Lindsey Hamm, a professional climber and mountain guide, brings a breath of fresh air to the world of mountaineering. Originally from Texas, she has begun making a name for herself in recent years. This short film offers a glimpse into her life, a recent expedition to Pakistan’s wild Charakusa Valley. Beyond the mountains, Lindsey is a people person, driven by a passion for inclusivity in climbing, and giving opportunities to other women, who want to get into the sport. She collaborates with womens organizations in Pakistan, helping to dismantle barriers and create opportunities for education and growth.

programme.title: Skiing China Exploring Altai Mountains
programme.desc: A quartet of champion skiers and snowboarders from Australia and the USA visit the unexplored Altai Frontier in China, now believed to be the place where skiing first developed, more than 10,000 years ago. They encounter the ancient culture of the region and explore the spectacular local slopes, using their own hi-tech equipment as well as the traditional skis manufactured by local craftsmen using age-old practices. The four visitors, Scott Kneller, Jari Hiatt, Halina Boyd and Harry Kearney, all of whom have world-beating careers in snowboarding, skiing and ski mountaineering, discover new challenges and new frontiers in China’s remote north-western province.

programme.title: Alone And Without A Guide On Mexico s Third Highest Mountain-Iztaccihuatl Eng
programme.desc: Being alone and without a guide in a summit attempt for the third highest mountain in Mexico was a dream. The climb is amazing. The ridge to Iztaccihuatls summit feels endless, but the views of the surrounding valleys and Popocatepetl make the effort worth it.

programme.title: Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025
programme.desc: Nestled in the heart of the Swiss Alps, the Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025 is one of the most exciting events on the freeride calendar. This unique competition brings together some of the world’s top backcountry athletes, showcasing their incredible skills and creativity in untouched snow.

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2025
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe. This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers.

programme.title: Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025
programme.desc: Nestled in the heart of the Swiss Alps, the Nendaz Backcountry Invitational 2025 is one of the most exciting events on the freeride calendar. This unique competition brings together some of the world’s top backcountry athletes, showcasing their incredible skills and creativity in untouched snow.

programme.title: Norcha Eng
programme.desc: Norcha is more than a race — it’s a journey into the heart of human endurance. Set against the breathtaking landscapes of northern Portugal, Norcha follows teams of adventurers as they leave their comfort zones and confront a challenge designed to push the very limits of body and mind. Trekking, kayaking, mountain biking, rappelling — every stage forces competitors to adapt, to endure, and to discover new depths of resilience. But Norcha is not just about competition. It is about connection — with teammates, with nature, and with the spirit of exploration itself. Guided by values of solidarity, humility, and dedication, this odyssey reveals that the greatest victories are not only measured at the finish line, but in the moments of transformation along the way.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2025 Season Recap - Unfinished Business Eng
programme.desc: This exclusive episode offers fans a fresh and emotional look back at the season, featuring the most thrilling moments, behind-the-scenes insights, and never-before-seen interviews with the athletes who defined the year.

programme.title: New Zealand 9
programme.desc: In a race against time, three adventurers will set a new speed record by completing New Zealand’s nine Great Walks faster than they’ve ever been done before, using human power alone. It’s the ultimate adventure race. They’ll kayak 145 km, ride 80 km and run over 300 km in just nine days.

programme.title: The High
programme.desc: THE HIGH is a feature length documentary film about the making of the longest high altitude foot race in the world. The film follows the path of a group of extreme runners who individually decide to take part of a dangerous running experiment gone wrong. Indian race director Rajat Chauhan works against the advice of the military, his family and friends to create a race over the two highest passes in the world (above 17 500ft). The decline begins from the start, with runners collapsing from dehydration, hypothermia, and high-altitude sickness. And by its end finds the entire race in jeopardy and the prospect that no one finishes. Brought to life by archive footage, story recreations, and interviews, the film unfolds the events in the Himalayas of Northern India and gives a unique look into the lives of the extreme marathon runners involved. Uncovering the avalanches, athletes, and the high altitude elements. THE HIGH shows the rewards of determination, the dangers of obsession, and in the end leaves you with the answer of why they called it, the toughest race on earth. Directed by Barry Walton.

programme.title: Trans Sahara Marathon 2025
programme.desc: The Trans Sahara Marathon. Set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Sahara Desert, this epic race, held in February 2025, challenges runners to traverse 150 kilometers across four grueling stages of unforgiving terrain. Drawing the worlds top athletes from every corner of the globe, the Trans Sahara Marathon is more than just a race; its a testament to the boundless limits of human potential and the relentless pursuit of greatness.

programme.title: X-out Montenegro Eng
programme.desc: X-out Montenegro is part of the Xtri World Tour. Athletes starts with a 1.7 km open-water course. The race is started by the Xekutioner, a formidable figure who will be responsible for future eliminations. 15 of athletes will be eliminated by the Xekutioner, intensifying the competition. Eliminated athletes are given a time penatly and can then try to catch “The Splitter” to ovetake backmarkers and get back in the race! Then a tough and demanding 40 km asphalt cycle which climbs the famous serpentine above Kotor. Designed to test endurance to the max. Another 15 of athletes are eliminated by the Xekutioner here, ensuring only the toughest stay. Finally 6.5 km of downhill trail running and 2.5 km of “vertical” monster climbing. Again eliminated athletes have the opportunity to catch the leaders.

programme.title: Ultra Vegans
programme.desc: For endurance athletes, getting the right diet can make the difference between success and failure. Many are now choosing to adopt a plant based regime and they are witnessing some remarkable results in terms of performance and recovery. Athletes, fitness coaches, sports nutritionists, ultra runners are sharing with us their experience and conviction wether they are motivated by self performance or animal wellfare.

programme.title: Cycling home from China Eng
programme.desc: Josh spent 4 months self filming his bike trip home from the Giant bike factory in Shanghai. During his 15 000 km trip between Shanghai China and Newcastle UK, he crossed 19 countries. A fantastic human adventure and a unique bike trip !

programme.title: The First Second - Michi Wohlleben
programme.desc: «The higher you raise the bar the further you fall down!”. Michi language is made of very strong, singular sentences, as sharpened as his climbing style. His sentences try to define himself, without worrying about himself, by thwarting clichés… but do not succeed in really finding himself. On the other hand his words create beautiful images that show Michis inspiration, fluidity, and pleasure in action. Through the discovery of his goals and his gamble with the risk, Michi mixes both quest and primal pleasure.

programme.title: Hokkaido Japan by bike - Part 4 Eng
programme.desc: Our bikepacker friend Michele is exploring the Japanese island of Hokkaido. On the agenda: volcanoes, forests, wilderness, brown bears, fishing owls, the Pacific Ocean, and weather that isnt always kind. Episode 4.

programme.title: Spartan Beast World Championship 2025 Eng
programme.desc: Spartan is back again to the culturally rich and visually intoxicating dunes of Abu Dhabi, UAE for the 2025 Spartan World Championship hosted by Abu Dhabi Sports Council. The Spartan World Championship weekend will include a variety of different World Championship races. A select group of top elites will battle for the 3K Elite World Championship title, while Elite and Age Group racers looking for a more grueling challenge will take on the qualification-based 21K Beast Championships.

programme.title: UIPM 2025 Obstacle World Championships
programme.desc: Beijing’s Olympic Centre turns into a proving ground as the UIPM Obstacle World Championships crown new stars across the 400 m, 3 K, and blistering 100 m sprint.

programme.title: International Temiscamingue Raid Eng
programme.desc: The International Temiscamingue Raid is the first stage event to be part of the Adventure Race World Series, an international series that specializes in adventure races and which brings together the best endurance athletes in the world. Last September, athletes from Brazil, Uruguay, Mexico, Finland and Canada and seven local teams from Temiscamingue participated in the Raid Témiscamingue.

programme.title: Hokkaido Japan by bike - Part 3 Eng
programme.desc: Our bikepacker friend Michele is exploring the Japanese island of Hokkaido. On the agenda: volcanoes, forests, wilderness, brown bears, fishing owls, the Pacific Ocean, and weather that isnt always kind. Episode 3.

programme.title: Spartan Super World Championship 2025 Eng
programme.desc: High in Californias Sierra Nevada, the world gathers for a new test of endurance. This is the Spartan Super World Championship 2025, hosted by Mammoth Lakes, California. A race that starts at 2,400 metres above sea level and climbs higher still. Every athlete knows what waits ahead. 11 kilometres, 26 obstacles and the full force of the mountain.

programme.title: 12th Longines Equestrian Beijing Masters 2025
programme.desc: China. Beijing. A city where history breathes through every stone and shimmer of steel. Here, where dynasties once rode across vast plains, a new kind of cavalry takes the stage riders of precision, courage, and grace. Each autumn, the National Stadium, the Bird’s Nest transforms. Where Olympic legends once soared, hooves now thunder. This is the Longines Beijing Masters — the heart of Asian equestrian sport, and a meeting place for the world’s finest.

programme.title: The First Second - Geraldine Fasnacht
programme.desc: When Geraldine, the bird woman puts on her mask, we know that the images of the pink wingsuit will be closer to poetry than adrenaline! Several snowboard world championship titles, more than 3200 jumps, but at the start, how do you decide to ride and fly all your life?

programme.title: The Road Ahead
programme.desc: Fredrik Erixon, a passionate adventurer crosses Sweden on roller skis from the north in Karesuando in Lappland, to Smygehuk in Skane in the south – a solo journey of about 2000 km over thirty days - representing one Vasaloppet a day (most famous cross country ski race). He rolls across the Arctic Polar Circle, meets interesting people and examines his own motivation in challenging himself and pushing his comfort zone.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2025 - Christmas Special Edition
programme.desc: We start this episode from Romania. In our previous episodes, we covered the exciting 2025 edition of Brasov Running Festival, highlighting the effort of the Elite 10k athletes. However, the Brasov Running Festival is much more than just the elite competitors. We then shift our focus to cycling, moving on to Turkey for another edition of LÉtape Türkiye by Tour de France. Moving from Turkey, we catch a flight to Croatia for Spartan Trail Dubrovnik. Since this is the last episode of the TV Show for 2025, we also got a glimpse of some of the most notable moments we enjoyed over the previous months.

programme.title: The First Second - Geraldine Fasnacht
programme.desc: When Geraldine, the bird woman puts on her mask, we know that the images of the pink wingsuit will be closer to poetry than adrenaline! Several snowboard world championship titles, more than 3200 jumps, but at the start, how do you decide to ride and fly all your life?

programme.title: The First Second - Michi Wohlleben
programme.desc: «The higher you raise the bar the further you fall down!”. Michi language is made of very strong, singular sentences, as sharpened as his climbing style. His sentences try to define himself, without worrying about himself, by thwarting clichés… but do not succeed in really finding himself. On the other hand his words create beautiful images that show Michis inspiration, fluidity, and pleasure in action. Through the discovery of his goals and his gamble with the risk, Michi mixes both quest and primal pleasure.

programme.title: Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025
programme.desc: Nedbank Gravel Burn is a 7-day, 800km full-service gravel stage race through South Africa’s diverse landscapes. Starting in coastal forests, the route heads into the breathtaking Great Karoo – a vast, spectacular semi-desert region. Riders rest each night in remote ‘Burn Camps’ under star-filled skies and, on the final day, greeted by Africa’s iconic Big 5 wildlife.

programme.title: Santos Tour Down Under Men 2026
programme.desc: Australia’s greatest cycling race is back to launch the international cycling season. South Australia is celebrated at its best, taking the peloton across 6 stages. The 2026 Santos Tour Down Under mens race features a tough climb - Knotts Hill. Each stage pays homage to the events history while exploring great landscapes, promising thrilling challenges for the riders.

programme.title: Santos Tour Down Under Women 2026
programme.desc: 9th edition of the Womens Tour Down Under, which is the part of the 2026 UCI Womens World Tour.

programme.title: 2025 Aus Cycling MTB Enduro National Championships
programme.desc: A rain-soaked Collie, Western Australia, becomes the stage for Australia’s premier Enduro showdown, where world-class Wambenger Trails and the iconic Wellington Dam mural frame a weekend of grit, flow and community. Across Juniors, Masters, Adaptive and E-bike fields, riders wrestle slick rock, pea gravel and long liaison climbs as stories of resilience emerge. The result is a kinetic, human-centred portrait of Australian MTB: fast, muddy, inclusive, and unforgettable.

programme.title: Skoda Titan Desert Almeria 2025
programme.desc: Four intense days of mountain biking through Almería’s stunning landscapes — from coast to desert, across sand, hills, and rugged trails. Amateurs and pros alike face the heat, the wind, and their own limits. More than a race, it’s an adventure of endurance, camaraderie, and pure adrenaline beyond the stopwatch.

programme.title: Race to the Rock
programme.desc: The Race to the Rock is an annual unsupported ultra-distance bicycle race through the Australian Outback organized by Jesse Carlsson. Unlike stage races, such as the Tour De France, ultra-distance races start and run continuously until the competitors finish the race, forcing them to make such strategic choices as whether it would be better to take time to eat or sleep, or to sacrifice those things and press on. Race to the Rock is an unsupported race, which means that racers are not permitted to draft or to obtain help from anything other than publicly available sources that are available for all. The course varies every year, but finishes at Uluru, also known as Ayers Rock, and has been so gruelling that only a very small percentage of the competitors have ever finished the race. Roads are mostly unsealed, with limited water supplies, and stretches of 400-500 kilometres at times with no food resupply available.

programme.title: Inside Desertus Bikus Eng
programme.desc: Josh partcipates to Desertus Bikus, an ultra cycling race that crosses Spain and Portugal starting in Hasparren in the Basque Country and finishing in Setubal Portugal. Josh is cycling during 1400 km across desert areas, villages, gravel tracks and asphalt roads.

programme.title: Skoda Titan Desert Almeria 2025
programme.desc: Four intense days of mountain biking through Almería’s stunning landscapes — from coast to desert, across sand, hills, and rugged trails. Amateurs and pros alike face the heat, the wind, and their own limits. More than a race, it’s an adventure of endurance, camaraderie, and pure adrenaline beyond the stopwatch.

programme.title: Inside Sailing 2025 - Episode 12
programme.desc: In our previous episode Italy was on the spotlight. The world’s top WingFoil racers were building up towards the most important event of the season, the first ever Formula Wing World Championships. We also attended Dutch Water Week, that is the premier celebration of sport and water in Netherlands. We will start this episode from Brazil where the Wingfoil Racing World Cup roared back to life on Brazil’s north-east coast, launching its season finale. We will also travel to Turkey, where the Bosphorus turned into a sea of color and pride as the 6th Presidential International Yacht Races concluded with its grand finale. Leaving action aside, we will travel to Malta for for the Malta Boat Show.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup Dakhla - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: A full roster of 28 men and 16 women, from a total of 16 countries around the world, are set to join the line-up in Dakhla for five days of intense action that could have a key bearing on who takes the titles. Reigning world champions, France’s Capucine Delannoy and Brazil’s Gabriel Benetton, top the Kite-Surf rankings as they head to the season’s penultimate stop in Dakhla, Morocco, on the Sahara desert’s coastline.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup Taiba - Brazil 2025
programme.desc: The second and final call of the GKA Freestyle season is set to play out in the sumptuous conditions of Brazil’s Taíba lagoon, where the 2025 world champions will be crowned. The world championship titles are in the balance after the opening stop in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, several weeks ago, ended inconclusively when the wind declined to play ball for the freestylers. That effectively makes the GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup Taíba 2025 a one-stop world championship for the 2025 titles, leaving no margin for slip-ups from leading contenders, who are all in Brazil.

programme.title: GKA Hydrofoil Big Air World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi will host the GKA Kite World Tour for the first time, bringing back-to-back World Cups in Hydrofoil Big Air and Freestyle to Fahid Island, Abu Dhabi’s newest coastal wellness destination and the world’s first Fitwel-certified island, offering 11kms of coastline.

programme.title: Moana Waiwai - The Film
programme.desc: Moana Waiwai or The Great Ocean in Maori, is about the FreeSwim journey of wahine (woman) Ally Davey as she swims 70km of open ocean around the stunning Coromandel coastline over three days to raise awareness for the protection of New Zealands oceans. It does more than encapsulate stunning vistas and highlight the extraordinary New Zealand environment. It inspires people to be aware of the natural beauty that surrounds them.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates hosts the GWA Wingfoil World Cup for the first time, marking the grand finale of the 2025 FreeFly-Slalom season. Leading the charge are two-time defending world champions, Nia Suardiaz, of Spain, and Francesco Cappuzzo, of Italy, who head to Abu Dhabi leading the rankings. With the season’s final stop still wide open, both athletes will need flawless performances to secure their third consecutive titles.

programme.title: 2025 ROLEX New York Yacht Club Invitational Cup
programme.desc: Twenty teams from 12 countries would compete in the ninth Rolex New York Yacht Club Invitational Cup, the biennial regatta hosted by the New York Yacht Club Harbour Court in Newport, R.I. Since the event was first run in 2009, it has attracted top amateur sailors from 51 of the world’s most prestigious yacht clubs from 23 countries.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup Taiba - Brazil 2025
programme.desc: Taíba, Brazil, host the final stop of the GKA Kite World Tour 2025. The world’s top riders will take to Taíba’s powerful Atlantic waves for four days of action-packed competition that will determine the men’s and women’s world titles. The event marks the thrilling conclusion to a season that has already visited Cape Verde, Dakhla, and Sylt.

programme.title: One Water Race 2025 - The Film Eng
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 10 mixed teams of 4 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness.

programme.title: All The Way Eng
programme.desc: From award-winning documentary filmmaker Carl Eneroth at Sthlm Social Innovation Lab comes "All the Way". A heart-pounding, intimate and mind expanding portrait of Swimrun team Pontus Lindberg and George Bjälkemo, as they prepare for their ultimate challenge… winning the 75 km ÖtillÖ Swimrun World Championships in the Stockholm archipelago… in trail shoes and a wetsuit.

programme.title: Nastro Rosa Tour 2025 Eng
programme.desc: The Marina Militare Nastro Rosa Tour returns in 2025 for its fifth edition, offering a unique journey that blends high-level competition with Italy’s maritime culture and coastal beauty. Since its debut in 2021, the Tour has grown into more than a sailing event—it has become a travelling festival of the sea, connecting athletes, coastal cities, and local communities in a shared celebration of sport, heritage, and discovery.

programme.title: Best Via Ferrata in the Julian Alps Eng
programme.desc: Just about an hours drive from Ljubljana airport, Prisojnik, or Prisank as its also called is a beautiful 2,547m mountain in Slovenias Julian Alps.This one-day via Ferrata route is a must-do since it presents an excellent hiking and climbing challenge, but also offers all of the views youd even want. To get to its summit Cris and Viv hiked, scrambled, climbed, and even crawled on their stomachs at points, but the views in the end and the feeling of satisfaction that came after made it all worthwhile.

programme.title: Dark Peak Fell Runners
programme.desc: The Dark Peak Fell Runners base themselves in Sheffield, but their playground is the Peak District National Park where they weave tracks through the fields, peat bogs and rocky outcrops to create a tapestry of eccentricity, endeavour and endurance. As one of the biggest pure fell running clubs in the UK, the ‘Dark Peak Fell Runners’ captures the personality, quirks and successes of the club and its members. Shot throughout the course of a year, the film follows in their footsteps to reveal their well-trodden Peak District running routes including the club’s flagship race, the Edale Skyline. (Special Thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: Aussie 8
programme.desc: Aussie 8 is the adventure of 3 friends who decided to climb the 8 tallest mountains in 8 Australian states in 8 days. To make this possible, they had to put together and respect a very strict timing and logistic organisation.

programme.title: Grand Teton Loop Eng
programme.desc: Grand Teton National Park is a stunning and iconic park in the US, known for its majestic Teton Range, beautiful lakes, and diverse wildlife. In July of 2022, Jeff and Audrée made a stop on their way back to Canada while on a road trip to Colorado, so that they could run a 38 mile / 62 km loop around the park, which mile for mile would be one of the most scenic and beautiful routes theyve ever run.

programme.title: A Feather in the West
programme.desc: In September 2019, a team of talented Irish climbers [Chloe Condron, Kevin Kilroy, Michelle OLoughlin and Conor McGovern] travelled to the small island of Owey to explore sea cliffs that local guidebook writer Iain Miller claims, have “enough new routing potential to last at least twelve lifetimes”. ‘A Feather in the West’ is a film about their trad climbing experiences and the relatively niche pursuit of first ascents, set on the Wild Atlantic Way, off the west coast of County Donegal. (Special thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: Summiting Mt Sneffels in Colorado Eng
programme.desc: Mount Sneffels is a prominent mountain near Ouray, Colorado in the United States which is over 14,000 feet high, more than 4,300 metres. Audree had never climbed a 14er, so we decided to try reach its summit while on a road trip through Colorado in late-July.

programme.title: Alone And Without A Guide On Mexico s Third Highest Mountain-Iztaccihuatl Eng
programme.desc: Being alone and without a guide in a summit attempt for the third highest mountain in Mexico was a dream. The climb is amazing. The ridge to Iztaccihuatls summit feels endless, but the views of the surrounding valleys and Popocatepetl make the effort worth it.

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2025
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe. This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers.

programme.title: Climbing Skye s Highest Peak - Sgurr Alasdair
programme.desc: Cris and Viv decided to climb Sgurr Alasdair, the highest mountain on the island of Skye, located in an area of the mountain range known as Black Cullin. The main challenge they had in climbing the peak was the Great Stone Chute. A 300-meter slope of the harshest mountain terrain - scree. The summit of Sgurr Alasdair has unobstructed views of all of the Munroes in the Black Cullin, and also of one of Skyes most famous routes - The Cullin Ridge traverse.

programme.title: Nine Mountains
programme.desc: The journey of two cyclists (Leo Russell & George Stagg) on a mission to climb the 9 most challenging and notorious mountains in Europe. From Austria To Spain, Nine Mountains is an adventure of brutality and beauty exploring the limits of the mind and body. The boys cycled over 3,200km from blistering snowstorms to scorching deserts whilst ascending the equivalent of eight times the height of Everest. The film follows a never been done route with the aim to raise £100,000 towards mens mental health charity James Place, an organisation set up to help men in suicidal crisis.

programme.title: Ultra Vegans
programme.desc: For endurance athletes, getting the right diet can make the difference between success and failure. Many are now choosing to adopt a plant based regime and they are witnessing some remarkable results in terms of performance and recovery. Athletes, fitness coaches, sports nutritionists, ultra runners are sharing with us their experience and conviction wether they are motivated by self performance or animal wellfare.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2025 Season Recap - Unfinished Business Eng
programme.desc: This exclusive episode offers fans a fresh and emotional look back at the season, featuring the most thrilling moments, behind-the-scenes insights, and never-before-seen interviews with the athletes who defined the year.

programme.title: X-out Montenegro Eng
programme.desc: X-out Montenegro is part of the Xtri World Tour. Athletes starts with a 1.7 km open-water course. The race is started by the Xekutioner, a formidable figure who will be responsible for future eliminations. 15 of athletes will be eliminated by the Xekutioner, intensifying the competition. Eliminated athletes are given a time penatly and can then try to catch “The Splitter” to ovetake backmarkers and get back in the race! Then a tough and demanding 40 km asphalt cycle which climbs the famous serpentine above Kotor. Designed to test endurance to the max. Another 15 of athletes are eliminated by the Xekutioner here, ensuring only the toughest stay. Finally 6.5 km of downhill trail running and 2.5 km of “vertical” monster climbing. Again eliminated athletes have the opportunity to catch the leaders.

programme.title: Raid Gallaecia 2025
programme.desc: In the frontier between Galicia and northern Portugal, adventure racing returned to one of Europe’s most unspoiled regions with Raid Gallaecia 2025. Over five days and nearly 500 kilometers, 28 international teams battled mountains, forests, rivers, and exhaustion in a non-stop race of strategy, endurance, and teamwork.

programme.title: Norcha Eng
programme.desc: Norcha is more than a race — it’s a journey into the heart of human endurance. Set against the breathtaking landscapes of northern Portugal, Norcha follows teams of adventurers as they leave their comfort zones and confront a challenge designed to push the very limits of body and mind. Trekking, kayaking, mountain biking, rappelling — every stage forces competitors to adapt, to endure, and to discover new depths of resilience. But Norcha is not just about competition. It is about connection — with teammates, with nature, and with the spirit of exploration itself. Guided by values of solidarity, humility, and dedication, this odyssey reveals that the greatest victories are not only measured at the finish line, but in the moments of transformation along the way.

programme.title: Trans Sahara Marathon 2025
programme.desc: The Trans Sahara Marathon. Set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Sahara Desert, this epic race, held in February 2025, challenges runners to traverse 150 kilometers across four grueling stages of unforgiving terrain. Drawing the worlds top athletes from every corner of the globe, the Trans Sahara Marathon is more than just a race; its a testament to the boundless limits of human potential and the relentless pursuit of greatness.

programme.title: New Zealand 9
programme.desc: In a race against time, three adventurers will set a new speed record by completing New Zealand’s nine Great Walks faster than they’ve ever been done before, using human power alone. It’s the ultimate adventure race. They’ll kayak 145 km, ride 80 km and run over 300 km in just nine days.

programme.title: Challenge Family 2025 - Season Wrap Up Eng
programme.desc: Since its founding, the Challenge Family triathlon series has redefined the spirit of endurance sports. Known for its unique courses, passionate community, and athlete-centered values, Challenge Family offers races in some of the world’s most iconic locations. From the breathtaking landscapes to the demands of each event, Challenge Family is about more than just competition. It’s about athletes pushing beyond their limits, fueled by the support of fans, family, and each other. Through the journeys of athletes, everyone can understand what it takes to prepare, to overcome, and to race with a purpose that goes far beyond the finish line.

programme.title: Trail Menorca Cami De Cavalls 2025
programme.desc: Welcome to a new edition of the Trail Menorca Camí de Cavalls Conecta Balear. 185 kilometers tracing the edge of a millennia-old island, blessed with unique natural beauty. Enchanted trails, towering cliffs, and dreamlike beaches shape one of the most demanding routes in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: Changing Channels
programme.desc: Gerrard Gosens is set to become the first totally blind person to attempt the daunting 34+ km swim from Dover in the UK to Cape Gris-Nez in France. Battling the cold and unpredictable waters of the English Channel, Gerrard faces not only the rough conditions but also the need to swim in synchronization with his team of guide swimmers, Hayden, Phil, Jo, Rosie, Alexis, and Sarah by his side.

programme.title: Oman Downwinder Eng
programme.desc: The Oman Downwinder movie intents to show Oman and its conditions for wind powered sports. It is a movie that explores behaviours, the Omani hospitality, the landscape and attractions of Oman within the downwinder route and not, exclusively, a movie about kitesufing/Wingfoiling. The movie was designed to explore the experience of professional kiteboarders/wingfoilers (Ambassadors) interacting with amateur riders based in Oman on this 7-day trip along the coast. Apart from the Ambassadors, the movie also explores the Oman Kitesurfing community via local actors and their experiences during the downwinder.

programme.title: Nastro Rosa Tour 2025 Eng
programme.desc: The Marina Militare Nastro Rosa Tour returns in 2025 for its fifth edition, offering a unique journey that blends high-level competition with Italy’s maritime culture and coastal beauty. Since its debut in 2021, the Tour has grown into more than a sailing event—it has become a travelling festival of the sea, connecting athletes, coastal cities, and local communities in a shared celebration of sport, heritage, and discovery.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cl ac h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: 2025 ROLEX New York Yacht Club Invitational Cup
programme.desc: Twenty teams from 12 countries would compete in the ninth Rolex New York Yacht Club Invitational Cup, the biennial regatta hosted by the New York Yacht Club Harbour Court in Newport, R.I. Since the event was first run in 2009, it has attracted top amateur sailors from 51 of the world’s most prestigious yacht clubs from 23 countries.

programme.title: One Water Race 2025 - The Film Eng
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 10 mixed teams of 4 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness.

programme.title: All The Way Eng
programme.desc: From award-winning documentary filmmaker Carl Eneroth at Sthlm Social Innovation Lab comes "All the Way". A heart-pounding, intimate and mind expanding portrait of Swimrun team Pontus Lindberg and George Bjälkemo, as they prepare for their ultimate challenge… winning the 75 km ÖtillÖ Swimrun World Championships in the Stockholm archipelago… in trail shoes and a wetsuit.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi will host the GKA Kite World Tour for the first time, bringing back-to-back World Cups in Hydrofoil Big Air and Freestyle to Fahid Island, Abu Dhabi’s newest coastal wellness destination and the world’s first Fitwel-certified island, offering 11kms of coastline.

programme.title: GKA Hydrofoil Big Air World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi will host the GKA Kite World Tour for the first time, bringing back-to-back World Cups in Hydrofoil Big Air and Freestyle to Fahid Island, Abu Dhabi’s newest coastal wellness destination and the world’s first Fitwel-certified island, offering 11kms of coastline.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup Taiba - Brazil 2025
programme.desc: The second and final call of the GKA Freestyle season is set to play out in the sumptuous conditions of Brazil’s Taíba lagoon, where the 2025 world champions will be crowned. The world championship titles are in the balance after the opening stop in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, several weeks ago, ended inconclusively when the wind declined to play ball for the freestylers. That effectively makes the GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup Taíba 2025 a one-stop world championship for the 2025 titles, leaving no margin for slip-ups from leading contenders, who are all in Brazil.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates hosts the GWA Wingfoil World Cup for the first time, marking the grand finale of the 2025 FreeFly-Slalom season. Leading the charge are two-time defending world champions, Nia Suardiaz, of Spain, and Francesco Cappuzzo, of Italy, who head to Abu Dhabi leading the rankings. With the season’s final stop still wide open, both athletes will need flawless performances to secure their third consecutive titles.

programme.title: SFT Wake Foil E-Foil World Cup Abu Dhabi 2025
programme.desc: Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates, will make history this autumn as it hosts the GWA Wingfoil World Cup for the first time, marking the grand finale of the 2025 FreeFly-Slalom season. Leading the charge are two-time defending world champions, Nia Suardiaz, of Spain, and Francesco Cappuzzo, of Italy, who head to Abu Dhabi leading the rankings. With the season’s final stop still wide open, both athletes will need flawless performances to secure their third consecutive titles.

programme.title: The First Second - Samantha Davies
programme.desc: Samantha Davies sees the ocean as a pleasure, obvious. In symbiosis with her boat, she leads a violent struggle with the harsh conditions and "loves it" in an almost inexplicable way! She knows and enjoys her luck, which she shares with Initiatives Cœur. She also measures it to that of her grandfather, a war submariner…. At the start of a race like the Vendée Globe, it is an adventurer who sets off.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cl ac h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: Alone And Without A Guide On Mexico s Third Highest Mountain-Iztaccihuatl Eng
programme.desc: Being alone and without a guide in a summit attempt for the third highest mountain in Mexico was a dream. The climb is amazing. The ridge to Iztaccihuatls summit feels endless, but the views of the surrounding valleys and Popocatepetl make the effort worth it.
