Then, the All Stars get out of the heat and head indoors to do some CQC training with Surviving Mann alum, Randy Couture. If anyone thought it would be a break.. they were surely mistaken.

programme.title: All Stars
programme.desc: Surviving Mann Season 1 thrilled with challenges, adventure and good old-fashioned American determination. But, before season 2 arrives, we have a new challenge for the best of the best. In All-Stars the top 3 Surviving Mann contestants will face off against 3 special operations veterans in a 48-hour no-sleep battle of endurance and willpower. Starting with a kayak, portage and run challenge, it’s time to discover if these top contestants are worthy of the name All-Stars.

programme.title: The Big Reveal
programme.desc: Step into the heart of innovation with The Big Reveal! Join Sheriff Mark Lamb and MMA legend Ken Shamrock as they explore groundbreaking American companies revolutionizing their industries. From elite camo designed through deer vision science to lightweight titanium firearm suppressors and EMF-neutralizing tech for peak performance—each story uncovers passion, ingenuity, and grit. Discover what’s shaping America’s entrepreneurial spirit. It’s not just business. It’s The Big Reveal.

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: In the premiere of Fortress, Sheriff Mark Lamb and co-hosts explore America’s urgent need for security—both personal and societal. They meet a passionate team turning donated land into a homestead that feeds and shelters trafficking survivors. Then, CCW Safe steps in to showcase how legal protection for concealed carriers can be the line between justice and ruin. Powerful stories of resilience, protection, and purpose unfold in this compelling first episode.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: The Glove Returns with a vengeance! This crop of contestants is the best of the best.. but how do they stack up against The Glove? Where about to find out. After The Glove waves goodbye, it’s hot-headed friend makes a debut courtesy of Exothermic Technologies. The contestants have a hard time keeping a smile off their faces as they shoot at targets and then blow them up.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: Surviving Mann returns with its most punishing season opener yet. In true Don Mann fashion, the bar is raised with a grueling 10-part physical readiness test—infused with a blast of hypothermia for good measure. Don himself calls it “the most brutal PT [he’s] ever witnessed,” and it’s clear the contestants are in for a world of hurt. To push them even further, MMA legend Ken Shamrock joins the fray, bringing his no-nonsense intensity to whip the group into fighting shape. Those who survive the trial by ice and exertion are rewarded with a chance to test-fire the lightest AR on the market—if they can still feel their trigger fingers.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: For the first time in Surviving Mann history, the contestants undergo intense combat training led by none other than Ken Shamrock—"the most dangerous man in the world." His relentless situation drills push this elite group beyond their limits, sharpening their instincts and forging next-level tactical readiness. As a new mission begins to take shape, the pressure mounts—and the team learns that the strongest among them will earn a game-changing reward. But in a world where every edge matters, not everyone is built to keep up. Fatigue sets in, tensions rise, and the difference between teammate and competitor begins to blur. With Shamrock watching closely, only the most disciplined will rise to meet the challenge—and prove they’re worthy of what lies ahead.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: Back by unpopular demand, the infamous “Blah Line” returns—and it’s more brutal than ever. The contestants kick off the day with a hellish PT session that leaves bodies broken and spirits tested. Things only get rougher from there with a punishing stealth crawl over jagged rocks, grinding them down before they face Ken Shamrock’s infamous Lion’s Den training—a relentless gauntlet of pain, grit, and raw endurance. As Don Mann continues to forge a battle-ready team, the squad is thrown into breaching drills designed for high-stakes mission execution. It’s chaos, it’s calculated, and it separates the contenders from the pretenders. In the heat of the action, two standouts emerge from the ranks—earning the coveted role of designated breachers.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: Surviving Mann returns with its most punishing season opener yet. In true Don Mann fashion, the bar is raised with a grueling 10-part physical readiness test—infused with a blast of hypothermia for good measure. programme.title: Surviving Mann

The contestants kick off the day with a hellish PT session that leaves bodies broken and spirits tested. As Don Mann continues to forge a battle-ready team, the squad is thrown into breaching drills designed for high-stakes mission execution. It’s chaos, it’s calculated, and it separates the contenders from the pretenders. In the heat of the action, two standouts emerge from the ranks—earning the coveted role of designated breachers.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: The day begins with a powerful dose of perspective as contestants hear real-life breaching stories from American heroes—reminders of the stakes they’re preparing for. The team is then introduced to a concealed firearm headrest safe designed for rapid-response vehicle defense. Next, it’s straight into the action with a preliminary course of fire using GreenLight sights, where top performers are pushed even further with a bonus round to test speed, accuracy, and composure under pressure. The intensity ramps up during a sentry scenario featuring SABRE CO₂ non-lethal cartridges, putting their stealth and judgment to the test. But just as the dust begins to settle, a new CIA briefing drops—and it’s the most dire yet. With mission reality closing in fast, the contestants close the day with a crash course in S.E.R.E. (Survival, Evasion, Resistance, and Escape) training, rounding out their classroom combat readiness with hard-earned grit.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: The stakes continue to climb as Green Light Sights rewards one top shooter with their very own custom weapon—proof that precision pays off. But there's no time to celebrate. Bear Arms ups the ante by issuing defense vests to every contestant, with one hard rule: once it’s on, it stays on. From grueling mission briefings to body armor plank challenges that push endurance to the brink, the weight—literally and mentally—never lets up. Still armored, the team reports to Ken Shamrock for another brutal dose of Lion’s Den physical punishment. Just when they think they’ve caught a break, Compliant Technologies’ infamous glove makes a shocking return to torment a fresh round of contestants. And as the day winds down, Don introduces the team to his personal “Flights” challenge—an unforgiving test no one is excited to take on. It all ends with a sobering CIA reminder: in the field, your backstory might just save your life—or end it.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: This week, memory meets mission as contestants face off in a high-stakes Kim’s Game challenge—designed to sharpen recall under pressure with 100 points and team leadership on the line. With observation, speed, and accuracy all in play, remembering every detail could make or break the mission. As the team pushes forward, it’s time to dig deeper. Contestants open up about their backstories, revealing the powerful personal reasons that brought them to the toughest reality show on earth. Some are here to prove something. Others? To fight for more than just themselves. The action intensifies as Hoffner Knives returns with a brutal tactical evolution, testing shooting and blade skills with precision under pressure. A split-second difference determines the winner of a major reward—proving that in this game, every tenth of a second matters. The day wraps with a visit from HCA Precision Barrels and one final classroom lesson—a pointed reminder that in the world of elite operators, your story is your strength… or your downfall.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: The episode opens with contestant Geoff Rempel sharing his powerful backstory and the unique challenges of competing without a military or firearms background—proving that heart, not just experience, earns a place on this team. As the mission begins, the team links up with Pete from Red Cat Drones to run light recon and test critical communication between ground and aerial support. Red Cat brings the best of the best to the skies while the team takes to the ground on bikes, learning to operate under pressure with real-time air-to-ground coordination. But it’s not all strategy and tech—emotions run high as contestant Hayley Taylor opens up about her late father and the personal mission driving her to push harder every day. From aerial coverage to cover stories, it’s not just about who’s strongest... it’s about who’s ready when it counts.

programme.title: Beyond the Close
programme.desc: In this episode, the contestants are off and running, putting what they've learned so far into practice and reaping the rewards. Now it's your turn! Learn what these pros have been learning and how you can use it to improve the value of your home and the safety and happiness of your life.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: The day kicks off with a one-of-a-kind “hatting ceremony” as Don Mann is crowned—then quite literally set on fire. But there’s no time to admire the flames; Ken Shamrock is waiting with another round of punishing Lion’s Den training. With Iron Man training just one day away, the pressure is at an all-time high. Contestant Landon reflects on his past Surviving Mann experience, paying tribute to the mentors who guided him—and now stepping into that role himself. The countdown to mission time begins as gear is packed, coordinates plotted, and details roll in via Red Cat Drones. With the ISR team deployed, the first phase of the mission is underway. Every contestant must be ready to deliver their cover for status in an instant—because in this game, hesitation can be the difference between success and failure.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: The stakes continue to climb as Green Light Sights rewards one top shooter with their very own custom weapon—proof that precision pays off. But there's no time to celebrate. It all ends with a sobering CIA reminder: in the field, your backstory might just save your life—or end it.

programme.title: Farm Hero
programme.desc: The rain simulator is up and running and the results are shocking. But where do we go from here? How do we fix what’s broken and return to farming with Mother Nature and not against it? Wayne Swanson in Chattanooga Tennessee has some answers. This special episode of Farm Hero highlights the important mission American farmers are on tackling to protect and revitalize our soil… with the help of some Swiss Army Bugs.

programme.title: Farm Hero
programme.desc: In part one of the season finale, Laura is immersing herself in all the wonders that are TomKat ranch. Created by Kat Taylor and Tom Steyer, TomKat ranch is part ranch, part laboratory, part educational facility and all around the American Dream. This ranch is doing their part at spear-heading the rural revitalization that will bring about climate stability and a healthier planet.

programme.title: Like a Train
programme.desc: Overconfidence can doom a season and the Knights meet their biggest obstacle of the year. Were they ready or not? Why was Coach Jesse so upset on Halloween night?

programme.title: Country Ball
programme.desc: The first part of the season finale starts now. Jesse’s back on his home turf of Clearwater, Florida, at Clearwater Academy International with not one, but TWO of his top players: Luca Stanzani and Dylan Djeté – who’ve both been playing football since they were little. Dylan’s a family-oriented player who got five touchdowns across his first two games in America. Luca’s been CAI’s starting quarterback since eighth grade and has both the brains and the dedication to go far. See just what these players can do in this episode of Country Ball!

programme.title: Like a Train
programme.desc: Overconfidence can doom a season and the Knights meet their biggest obstacle of the year. Were they ready or not? Why was Coach Jesse so upset on Halloween night?

programme.title: The Big Reveal
programme.desc: Take flight with The Big Reveal as Don Mann (Surviving Mann), Sheriff Mark Lamb (Surviving Mann), and Laura Zaspel (Farm Hero) visit Air Tractor—America’s iconic maker of crop dusters, firefighting, and military aircraft. Witness the power, precision, and pride behind the company proving that American craftsmanship still soars.

programme.title: The Big Reveal
programme.desc: Laura Zaspel (Farm Hero) takes you inside the cockpit for a high-flying look at the future of farming. From cutting-edge aerial applications to next-gen science and sustainability, Air Tractor’s technology is redefining how we grow from the ground up.

programme.title: Real Man TV
programme.desc: Ziplining in Colorado’s Gorges, free falls and donuts. The Real Man show is back in full swing in Colorado. Kyle is joined by special guests and American Patriots as he explores what thrills and adventures this amazing country has to offer. And he’s just getting started.

programme.title: Real Man TV
programme.desc: In the last episode, Kyle took to the skies; now it’s the seas. Co-host Josh Peterson joins Kyle on a deep sea fishing excursion that ends in one of them losing their lunch.. but who will it be? Later (after everyone’s cleaned up) the gang reconvenes for a legendary course of fire with some serious artillery.. and Bob.

programme.title: Like a Train
programme.desc: The Knights will face their biggest challenge yet. There be giants.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: Back by unpopular demand, the infamous “Blah Line” returns—and it’s more brutal than ever. The contestants kick off the day with a hellish PT session that leaves bodies broken and spirits tested. Things only get rougher from there with a punishing stealth crawl over jagged rocks, grinding them down before they face Ken Shamrock’s infamous Lion’s Den training—a relentless gauntlet of pain, grit, and raw endurance. As Don Mann continues to forge a battle-ready team, the squad is thrown into breaching drills designed for high-stakes mission execution. It’s chaos, it’s calculated, and it separates the contenders from the pretenders. In the heat of the action, two standouts emerge from the ranks—earning the coveted role of designated breachers.

programme.title: Surviving Mann
programme.desc: The day begins with a powerful dose of perspective as contestants hear real-life breaching stories from American heroes—reminders of the stakes they’re preparing for. The team is then introduced to a concealed firearm headrest safe designed for rapid-response vehicle defense. Next, it’s straight into the action with a preliminary course of fire using GreenLight sights, where top performers are pushed even further with a bonus round to test speed, accuracy, and composure under pressure. The intensity ramps up during a sentry scenario featuring SABRE CO₂ non-lethal cartridges, putting their stealth and judgment to the test. But just as the dust begins to settle, a new CIA briefing drops—and it’s the most dire yet. With mission reality closing in fast, the contestants close the day with a crash course in S.E.R.E. (Survival, Evasion, Resistance, and Escape) training, rounding out their classroom combat readiness with hard-earned grit.

programme.title: Real Man TV
programme.desc: Ziplining in Colorado’s Gorges, free falls and donuts. The Real Man show is back in full swing in Colorado. Kyle is joined by special guests and American Patriots as he explores what thrills and adventures this amazing country has to offer. And he’s just getting started.

programme.title: Real Man TV
programme.desc: In the last episode, Kyle took to the skies; now it’s the seas. Co-host Josh Peterson joins Kyle on a deep sea fishing excursion that ends in one of them losing their lunch.. but who will it be? Later (after everyone’s cleaned up) the gang reconvenes for a legendary course of fire with some serious artillery.. and Bob.

programme.title: Like a Train
programme.desc: Overconfidence can doom a season and the Knights meet their biggest obstacle of the year. Were they ready or not? Why was Coach Jesse so upset on Halloween night?

programme.title: Greatest Sports Legends Then and Now - Triumphs and Tragedies

programme.title: Greatest Sports Legends Then and Now - Tragedies

programme.title: Greatest Sports Legends Then and Now - Fascinating but Forgotten
programme.desc: Fun, fast-paced debate talk series comparing the sports legends of the past to sports titans of the present. Wes and Murph discuss hidden stories that most people don’t know about, including a tennis player who served as a spy during World War II.

programme.title: Greatest Sports Legends Then and Now - Overlooked and Underrated
programme.desc: Fun, fast-paced debate talk series comparing the sports legends of the past to sports titans of the present. Wes and Murph look at surprising teams that unexpectedly won it all, as well as some championship teams that have long been forgotten.

programme.title: Greatest Sports Legends Then and Now - Fan Mail
programme.desc: Fun, fast-paced debate talk series comparing the sports legends of the past to sports titans of the present.
